SEARCH
Package ru.introguzzle.parsers.common.function

Interface ThrowingConsumer<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the input to the operation
public interface ThrowingConsumer<T>
A functional interface similar to Consumer, but allows throwing checked exceptions.

The ThrowingConsumer interface represents an operation that accepts a single input argument and can throw any type of Throwable, including checked exceptions. This is useful when you need to work with lambda expressions or method references that throw checked exceptions.

Usage Example:


 ThrowingConsumer<String> consumer = s -> {
     if (s == null) {
         throw new Exception("Input cannot be null");
     }
     System.out.println(s);
 };

 // Converting to a standard Consumer that wraps exceptions into RuntimeException
 Consumer<String> safeConsumer = consumer.toConsumer();

 // Using the consumer
 try {
     safeConsumer.accept("Hello, World!");
 } catch (RuntimeException e) {
     // Handle exception
 }

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    accept(T t)
    Performs this operation on the given argument.
    default @NotNull ThrowingConsumer<T>
    andThen(@NotNull ThrowingConsumer<? super T> after)
    Returns a composed ThrowingConsumer that performs, in sequence, this operation followed by the after operation.
    default @NotNull Consumer<T>
    asConsumer()
    Transforms this throwing consumer into a plain Consumer, wrapping any thrown exceptions into a RuntimeException using a default transformer.
    default @NotNull Consumer<T>
    asConsumer(@NotNull Handler handler)
    Transforms this throwing consumer into a plain Consumer, using the provided Handler to handle exceptions without throwing them.
    default @NotNull Consumer<T>
    asConsumer(@NotNull Transformer<? extends RuntimeException> transformer)
    Transforms this throwing consumer into a plain Consumer, using the provided Transformer to handle exceptions by transforming them into a RuntimeException.

  • Method Details

    • accept

      void accept(T t) throws Throwable
      Performs this operation on the given argument.
      Parameters:
      t - the input argument
      Throws:
      Throwable - if unable to perform the operation

    • asConsumer

      @NotNull default @NotNull Consumer<T> asConsumer()
      Transforms this throwing consumer into a plain Consumer, wrapping any thrown exceptions into a RuntimeException using a default transformer.
      Returns:
      a Consumer that does not throw checked exceptions

    • asConsumer

      @NotNull default @NotNull Consumer<T> asConsumer(@NotNull @NotNull Transformer<? extends RuntimeException> transformer)
      Transforms this throwing consumer into a plain Consumer, using the provided Transformer to handle exceptions by transforming them into a RuntimeException.
      Parameters:
      transformer - the transformer to apply to any thrown exceptions
      Returns:
      a Consumer that does not throw checked exceptions
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the transformer is null

    • asConsumer

      @NotNull default @NotNull Consumer<T> asConsumer(@NotNull @NotNull Handler handler)
      Transforms this throwing consumer into a plain Consumer, using the provided Handler to handle exceptions without throwing them.
      Parameters:
      handler - the handler to process any thrown exceptions
      Returns:
      a Consumer that handles exceptions using the provided handler
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the handler is null

    • andThen

      @NotNull default @NotNull ThrowingConsumer<T> andThen(@NotNull @NotNull ThrowingConsumer<? super T> after)
      Returns a composed ThrowingConsumer that performs, in sequence, this operation followed by the after operation.
      Parameters:
      after - the operation to perform after this operation
      Returns:
      a composed ThrowingConsumer that performs in sequence this operation followed by the after operation
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if after is null
